data.content:
noun
plural scalps
[count] the skin on the top of your head where hair grows
hair and skin that is cut or torn from the head of an enemy as a sign of victory - often used figuratively
His boss wants his scalp. [=wants to fire him]
Parents of some students are (going) after the principal's scalp.
verb
scalps; scalped; scalping
[+ obj] to remove the hair and skin from the head of (an enemy) as a sign of victory
Some members of the tribe were scalped by the attacking warriors.
US :to buy tickets for an event and resell them at a much higher price
People were scalping [=(Brit) touting] tickets outside the stadium.

Danh từ
(ngành mỏ) sự sàng thô
